subject: Communication
question_text: Consider a channel over which either symbol $x_{A}$ or symbol $x_{B}$ is transmitted. Let the output of the channel $Y$ be the input to a maximum likelihood (ML) detector at the receiver. The conditional probability density functions for $Y$ given $x_{A}$ and $x_{B}$ are: ...
solution_text: Here source is transmitting two symbols $X_{A}$ \& $X_{B}$. [image1] $f_{y / x_{A}}(y)=e^{-(y+1)} u(y+1)$ $f_{y / x_{B}}(y)=e^{(y-1)}[1-u(x-1)]$ [image2] Calculation $\mathrm{V}_{\text {th }}$ optimum $\left.f_{Y / X_{A}}(Y)\right|_{Y=V_{t h}}=\left.f_{Y / X_{B}}(y)\right|_{Y=V_{\text {th }}} e^{-\left(v_{\text {th }}+1\right)}=e^{v_{\text {th }}-1} \Rightarrow V_{t h}=0$

subject: Geometry
question_text: A trapezium has vertices marked as $\mathrm{P}, \mathrm{Q}, \mathrm{R}$ and $\mathrm{S}$ (in that order anticlockwise). The side $\mathrm{PQ}$ is parallel to side $\mathrm{SR}$. Further, it is given that, $\mathrm{PQ}=11 \mathrm{~cm}, \mathrm{QR}=4$ $\mathrm{cm}, \mathrm{RS}=6 \mathrm{~cm}$ and $\mathrm{SP}=3 \mathrm{~cm}$. What is the shortest distance between $\mathrm{PQ}$ and $\mathrm{SR}$ (in $\mathrm{cm}$ )? (a) 1.80 (b) 2.40 (c) 4.20 (d) 5.76
